result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor R Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Provide Sex Offender Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Taylor R Peterson in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Taylor R Peterson in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:00 PM. Called 15CF168 and 15CF134. Court - according to plea questionnaire - the defendant will be pleading G to count #3 on 15CF134 and on 15CF168 - pleading G  to only count. State and Scholke and Peterson agree. State - parties will be free to argue sentence - there will be other counts dismissed and read in, counts #1, #2, #4 and #5 on 15CF134. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. Scholke informs Court that the repeater allegation in 15CF134 is being dismissed. State agrees. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - on 15CF168 - recommends 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - concurrent to anything he is currently serving; on 15CF134 - recommends 10 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES - concurrent to his existing sentence. State has complied with victim notification requirements - no restitution requested. Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends running everything concurrent to current sentence and asking the Court to not impose additional year of incarceration.Peterson makes statement, remorseful. Court dismisses and reads in counts #1, #2, #4 and #5 on 15CF134. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 15CF168 - count #1 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - concurrent to current sentence; 15CF134 - 10 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES - concurrent to current sentence, conditions of ES include: costs on each count - paid thru ES, submit DNA sample with surcharge assessed, not eligible for programs, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on June 30, 2016 at 12:10 pm.

Defendant Taylor R Peterson in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Defendant Taylor R Peterson in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 2:37 PM. Also called 15CF168, 14CM180 and 15CF134. Scholke only handling ARGN's today. Scholke has Information for both cases, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, sets both matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Called  - Taylor Peterson in person/custody and with attorney Michael Scholke. Scholke has WOPH - provides to court - court goes thru waiver and finds probable cause - binds over for trial - State files INFO - defendant files RFS - court accepts bond continued.

Defendant Taylor R Peterson in court with attorney Michael Scholke. Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:05 PM. Called 15CF168, 15CF134, 15CM179 & 15CM181. Scholke has went over each complaint with Peterson, asks for PH (15CF168 & 15CF134), waives time limits and asks for bond to be continued, on 15CM179 & 15CM181 enters NG pleas to all counts on each case and asks for bond to be continued. Peterson indicates he is waiting for revocation. Scholke updates court on revocation situation. Court continues bond on all cases and misdemeanor cases to be set as STC, tracking with CF cases.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Taylor R Peterson in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:40 PM. Also called 15CM179, 15CM181 and FOSO Incident #15-16273 Peterson does not have complaints. Court reads all charges and penalties for all three filed cases. Peterson understands all charges and penalties, wishes to have an attorney, cannot afford his own (previously represented by Mary Burns). Burns states that the defendant does qualify for SPD but states she has a conflict. Court sets all matters for AIA. State informs Court of the defendant's open case in Oconto County (15CF109). Court continues bond on 15CM179 as previously set. State - bond - 15CM181 - $2000.00 cash bond. Court - bond - 15CM181 - $2000.00 cash, no contact with Jessica Bildeau and no consumption of alcohol. State - bond - 15CF168 - $2000.00 cash. Court - bond on 15CF168 - $2000.00 cash. Court - sets bond on new probable cause (15-16273)- $2000.00 cash, no contact with James Smith and no entry onto any property owned by Smith Concrete and no consumption of alcohol.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.
